00036 /*
00037  *   util_cpu_time -- return a long which represents the elapsed processor
00038  *   time in milliseconds since some constant reference
00039  */
00040 long 
00041 util_cpu_time()
00042 {
00043     long t = 0;
00044 
00045 #ifdef BSD
00046     struct rusage rusage;
00047     (void) getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &rusage);
00048     t = (long) rusage.ru_utime.tv_sec*1000 + rusage.ru_utime.tv_usec/1000;
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #ifdef IBMPC
00052     long ltime;
00053     (void) time(&ltime);
00054     t = ltime * 1000;
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifdef UNIX60                   /* times() with 60 Hz resolution */
00058     struct tms buffer;
00059     times(&buffer);
00060     t = buffer.tms_utime * 16.6667;
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 #ifdef UNIX100
00064     struct tms buffer;          /* times() with 100 Hz resolution */
00065     times(&buffer);
00066     t = buffer.tms_utime * 10;
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 #ifdef vms
00070     tbuffer_t buffer;   /* times() with 100 Hz resolution */
00071     times(&buffer);
00072     t = buffer.proc_user_time * 10;
00073 #endif
00074 
00075     return t;
00076 }
